0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Tinea corporis: apply TOPICALLY to affected skin and approximately 1 inch of the immediate surrounding area(s) once daily for 1 week
  • Tinea cruris: apply TOPICALLY to affected skin and approximately 1 inch of the immediate surrounding area(s) once daily for 1 week
  • Tinea pedis: apply TOPICALLY a thin layer to affected area(s) and approximately 1 inch of the immediate surrounding area(s) once daily for 2 weeks

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono: report suspected adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Luliconazole is an azole antifungal that appears to inhibit the conversion of lanosterol to ergosterol (a component of fungal cell membranes) by inhibiting the enzyme lanosterol demethylase. Inhibition of the conversion of lanosterol to ergosterol causes accumulation of lanosterol and a decreased amount of ergosterol in fungal cell wall.

sub.title: Absorption
sub.mono: Tmax, Topical: 16.9 hours after first dose, 5.8 hours after final dose (tinea pedis); 21 hours after first dose, 6.5 hours after final dose (tinea cruris)

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
topical use only; not for oral, ophthalmic, or intravaginal use

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: improvement in the signs or symptoms of interdigital tinea pedis, tinea cruris, or tinea corporis is indicative of efficacy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Side effects may include application site reactions.
  • Advise patient that drug is not for oral, intravaginal, or ophthalmic use.
